Yes, several organizations are working towards promoting education and awareness on ethnic reconciliation in Sri Lanka. 

One such organization is the National Peace Council of Sri Lanka, which is a non-governmental organization focused on promoting peace and social harmony in the country. The council works towards building bridges between different communities through various programs, including interfaith dialogue, youth leadership, and advocacy.

Another organization is the Centre for Policy Alternatives, which works on a range of issues, including governance, human rights, and transitional justice. The center's initiatives include research, advocacy, and public awareness-raising on conflict-related issues.

Other organizations include the Institute of Policy Studies of Sri Lanka, the Consortium of Humanitarian Agencies, and the Peace Secretariat for Muslims. These groups work on various issues related to ethnic reconciliation, including conflict resolution, interfaith relations, and education.

Overall, there is a growing number of organizations in Sri Lanka working towards promoting education and awareness on ethnic reconciliation. Their efforts are vital in promoting understanding and creating an inclusive society that celebrates diversity and works towards building a peaceful and prosperous future for all.
